intro: Ovidia tenera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Ovidia tenera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
